pronunciation: TRAV'AIL, [Latin trans, over, beyond, and mael, work; Eng. moil.]

definitions.text:
Travail
1. To labor with pain; to toil.
2. To suffer the pangs of childbirth; to labor. Genesis 35:16.TRAV'AIL,
To harass; to tire; as troubles sufficient to travail the realm. [Not use.]TRAV'AIL,

Labor with pain; severe toil.As every thing of price, so doth this require travail
1. Labor childbirth; as severe travail; easy travail
